fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Upgrading UPM triggers all apps/applications to restart because of the licensing API provided by UPM. This can cause Jira to return 404 and other errors while the UPM upgrade is in progress, effectively causing downtime.
h3. Impact

Depending on the plugins in the instance, this can cause 404 and 500 errors on (at least) the following pages:
 * Dashboard.jpsa
 * JiraHome.jspa
 * Viewing any issue

This effectively renders Jira unavailable for the time it takes to update the UPM, which can be 5-10 minutes.
h3. Suggested Solution

As a Jira Server admin I want to update UPM, but I don't want all other apps/applications to depend on UPM.
h3. Workaround

Unfortunately there is no workaround at this time. Instances that are affected by this should have the UPM updated in a scheduled maintenance window.
fields.summary: Make UPM update not impact all other installed apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Apps downtime during the app upgrade process in Jira Server ends with users not being able to use the app.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Jira Server admin I would like apps/applications/plugins updates to never affect my end users work.
Apps upgrades cause no downtime for the app end users in Jira Server.
fields.summary: Eliminate apps downtime while performing app update in Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Apps downtime during the app upgrade process in Jira Server DC ends with users not being able to use the app.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Jira DC admin I would like plugins/apps/applications updates to be triggered sequentially and not in parallel on my DC nodes.

The node which is currently performing the plugins/apps/applications update should be switched to MAINTENANCE mode (/status endpoint) so users are never affected by plugins/apps/applications updates.

The described above functionality might extend the existing Zero Downtime Upgrades (ZDU) functionality in Jira Data Center.

More on Zero Downtime Upgrades: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-data-center-with-zero-downtime-938846953.html]
fields.summary: Add possibility to do a rolling apps update (extend ZDU functionality)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the mobile app does not support any logging that can be easily shared to troubleshoot any problem with the app.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to generate logs specific to the mobile app so it can be shared with the support team.


h3. Workaround 

* For Android: https://www.appdome.com/no-code-mobile-integration-knowledge-base/gathering-android-device-logs-using-adb/
* For iOS: https://www.hexnode.com/mobile-device-management/help/obtain-ios-device-logs-using-mac-and-windows/
fields.summary: Allow the mobile app to generate application logs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Jira Server admin I do not want to be encouraged to perform operations which can have destructive results on my Jira instance like:
* clicking yes to UPM upgrade pop-up.
* clicking update UPM button
in order to prevent the apps being unintentionally restarted and unavailable for my end users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Possible solutions: 
* remove the upgrade UPM pop-up
* add warnings in the UI after clicking the upgrade button
* add confirmation pop-up with warnings.
fields.summary: Add warnings to UPM upgrade pop-up and UPM update button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In order to know what are the implications of hitting the _"Update"_ button (precisely I would like to know how many plugins/apps/application will be temporary disabled).

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Jira Server admin I would like to know, what will be the impact of updating an app in Jira before I hit app/application "Update" button.
fields.summary: More information about the impact of upgrading an app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting an AD group does not automatically remove it from the Application Access page if you have granted this group with Application Access. Now, when you navigate to Application Access page, you will see the below error:
!app.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
Jira 8.3.2
Active Directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group from AD
# Sync the group in Jira
# Add the group in the Application Access
# Remove the group from AD and sync the directory to Jira
# Notice that it will be removed from the Jira Groups page
# Access the Application Access page

h3. Expected Results
No error and the group is automatically removed from the Application Access

h3. Actual Results
An error message is presented and there's no way we can get rid of the error.
!app.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround
# Recreate the group from AD
# Sync it back to Jira
# Remove the group from the Application Access page
# Delete the group once again from AD side
# Synchronize Jira
fields.summary: Deleting AD group does not automatically remove it from the Application Access page

fields.description: Can you please add a feature to allow sorting by last login under user management? It would be helpful to manage users with active status, but not actually using Jira since a long time. I know this is probably possible by running a query on the Jira DB, but it would be easier through user management tab in the UI.
fields.summary: Sorting by last login under user management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when performing searches on Jira, the results from them won't return a relevance score for the results that users can visualize.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ensure that Jira can provide data about the relevance from searches based on specific parameters (e.g. how many occurrences from the word are appearing on an issue), so Jira Users and Administrators can use this information.

fields.description:
h3. Jira doesn't start when Docker variable CLUSTER=true is set
When CLUSTER=true is set on docker variable, the {{cluster.properties}} file is automatically created. 
* The file includes all variables which can be manually set ([Reference - Installing Jira Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html])
* Unless those variables are set in the docker config, they are generated without any value
{noformat}
jira.node.id=node1
jira.shared.home=/var/atlassian/application-data/jira/shared
ehcache.peer.discovery=
ehcache.listener.hostName=
ehcache.object.port=
ehcache.listener.port=
ehcache.listener.socketTimeoutMillis=
ehcache.multicast.address=
ehcache.multicast.port=
ehcache.multicast.timeToLive=
{noformat}
* Source: [Bitbucket - docker-atlassian-jira - cluster.properties.j2|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian-docker/docker-atlassian-jira/src/master/config/cluster.properties.j2]

h3. Environment
* [Docker Hub - atlassian/jira-software|https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/jira-software]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy docker image with variable CLUSTER=true
** Example: 
{code}
docker run -v jiraVolume:/var/atlassian/application-data/jira -v jiraSharedVolume:/var/atlassian/application-data/jira/shared --name="jira" -p 8080:8080 -e=CLUSTERED=true -e=JIRA_NODE_ID=node1 atlassian/jira-software
{code}
# Use "I'll set it up myself" option
# Select "Built In (for evaluation or demonstration)" to speed setup steps along
** The same error is created even using your own database

Database creation continues and Jira starts up as expected

h3. Actual Results
The Jira process is terminated.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you create a board (scrum or kanban) using a filter that draws issues from a *business* project, the board will not have the same icon as the project.

h3. Environment

Any clean instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a board.
 # Assign a filter to it that draws issues from a business project. For instance: project = 'Business Type Project'
 # Check the board icon.

h3. Expected Results

The board icon would be the same as the project icon.

!Screen Shot 2019-09-10 at 18.02.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The board icon is not the same.

!Screen Shot 2019-09-10 at 18.02.44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Board icons do not match project icons for Business Type projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you select a workflow and choose to view, selecting a transition should display the screens associated with this transition. However, if you select the Diagram View and click on the transition, Jira fails to display that there is a screen associated with the transition, which can lead to confusion.

(i) Choosing to view the workflow as text displays the correct results.

h3. Environment

Any clean instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the *Jira Administration Icon* > *Issues*.
 # Select *Workflows* at the sidebar.
 # Select a workflow from the list and click on *Edit*.
 # Click on *Diagram* to enable the diagram view.
 # Click on a *transition* such as the *Close issue* transition.
 # The screen associated with the transition should be displayed at the box created after the transition has been selected. However, the screen is not displayed.

h3. Expected Results

The screen associated should be displayed.

 !Screen Shot 2019-09-10 at 12.07.18.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The screen associated is not displayed.

!Screen Shot 2019-09-10 at 12.39.01.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

If you click on *Edit* and "add" the same screen, this information will be correctly displayed.
fields.summary: Workflow's Diagram View does not display screen associated with a transition.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing an issue for example, via Quick Search, the URL will be like "http://localhost:8021/jira_821/browse/TEST-3?jql=project%20%3D%20TEST" upon clicking TEST-3 issue. Without the browse user permission, the user should be able to add a watcher by typing its full username as per [Unable to Browse for Users and Groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unable-to-browse-for-users-and-groups-120521888.html] but that's not the case. 
!error.png|thumbnail!

However, accessing the issue via "http://localhost:8021/jira_821/browse/TEST-3" works perfectly fine. As soon as I enter, the user will be added.
!full.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.10.2
 * JIRA 8.2.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user without Browse User Global permission but with *Manage Watchers* and *View Voters and Watchers* 
# Ask the user to login and access a ticket via quick search where the URL in the browser will be like "http://localhost:8021/jira_821/browse/TEST-3?jql=project%20%3D%20TEST" 
# Add watcher

h3. Expected Results
He should be able to add a watcher as per the documentation

h3. Actual Results
An error message is returned "The value 'xxxxx' is invalid". 

h3. Workaround
Add the watcher by accessing the issue on the full view with URL "http://localhost:8021/jira_821/browse/TEST-3"
fields.summary: Add Watcher Without Browse User Permission's Behaviour depends on the URL Jira is being accessed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In ATST *1.10.0* the index health check for JIRA  was disabled. See JRASERVER-67235

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement Lucene Index status and Issue consistency check

h3. Workaround
* Use REST endpoint:  GET {{<JIRA context>/rest/api/2/index/summary}}
** Please see docs for details:  https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.2.10/#api/2/index/summary

h3. Note on fix
REST APIs:
*  GET -  /rest/indexanalyzer/1/state?maxResults=10
** Runs the analysis, (!)(!)(!) this is an expensive call, it will add additional load to DB (!)(!)(!)
* GET -  /rest/indexanalyzer/1/statistics
** Returned if analysis where successfully done

In Jira issue can be in one of 5 different states:
* Index orphan - issue present only in index, should be removed
* DB orphan - issue present only in database, should be added to index
* Outdated issue - if issue in index is not the same as in database
* OK issue - if issues is the same in index and database
* Archived issue - if issue is archived 

Example:
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
{
    "indexOrphans": [
        {
            "issueId": 10101,
            "lastUpdated": 1528706295000
        }
    ],
    "dbOrphans": [
        {
            "issueId": 10306,
            "lastUpdated": 1529308219425
        }
    ],
    "outdatedIssueData": [
        {
            "issueId": 10102,
            "dbLastUpdated": 1528706225000,
            "indexLastUpdated": 1528706405655
        }
    ],
    "okCount": 72,
    "outdatedCount": 1,
    "indexOrphansCount": 1,
    "dbOrphansCount": 1,
    "lastAnalyzeTimestamp": 1529308274757,
    "indexHealth": 97.297295
}
{code}
Description: 
* indexOrphans, dbOrphans, outdatedIssueData, outdatedCount, indexOrphansCount, dbOrphansCount  - see above
* okCount → count of ok issues (from whole Jira)
* lastAnalyzeTimestamp → timestamp when analysis where done
* indexHealth → percentage of issues that or not in index or they are outdated, example: 97.297295 → 97.29% percents of issues in database are ok in index
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want check Lucene Index and Issues consistency

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.manager.OptionsManager allows to create options for customfields of type 'multi-line text'
h3. Environment

Jira Software
h3. Steps to Reproduce

(Script)
 # get a custom field (e.g. text field multi-line):
 cf = ComponentAccessor.getCustomFieldManager().getCustomFieldObject(...)
 # get a specific field config from that field -> I get the field config based on an issue as:
 config = cf.getRelevantConfig(issue)
 # create a new option for that config:
 option = ComponentAccessor.getOptionsManager().createOption(config, ...)
 # this last call retrieves the created option -> I can read out anything from that option, the ID, name, etc. (which from my perspective is somehow unexpected)
 # what I also can do afterwards when written down the option ID: access the option from another script via:
 option = optionsManager.findByOptionId(<optionID>)
 by this I receive also the option and can again read out any info such as name/value, if it is disabled or not, etc.

h3. Expected Results

An error message is prompted when trying to create options for a field different from type 'select', 'radio button' and 'checkbox'.
h3. Actual Results

When the script runs on a text field, it creates an option and it is possible to disable and enable it programmatically.
fields.summary: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.manager.OptionsManager allows to create options for customfields of type 'multi-line text'

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

h3. Suggested resolution
Provide solution to determine which issue types will be visible on drop-down list when moving issues.
fields.summary: Possibility to hide specific issue types when moving issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you click "Take me to Jira" button in Latest upgrade report it doesn't close the report.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Jira
 # Go to <Jira_URL>/secure/PostUpgradeLandingPage.jspa
 !Screenshot 2019-09-09 at 21.06.53.png|thumbnail! 
 # Click "Take me to Jira" button in the lower right corner

h3. Expected Results
You are taken to the Jira home page (by default System Dashboard)

h3. Actual Results
Button does nothing

h3. Workaround
You can use the top panel to navigate to any of the Jira views, e.g. to Dashboard.

h3. Notes
This behavior *only occurs* when the [Context Path|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/set-a-context-path-for-atlassian-applications-836601189.html] is not set in the instance.
fields.summary: Clicking "Take me to Jira" button in Latest upgrade report does nothing

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Add some validator and warning message in JIRA when a user enters a date (year part) using dd/MM/yy, while the input date format is set to dd/MM/yyyy

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Go to _Administration > General Configuration > Advanced_.
 # Change the *jira.date.picker.java.format* from *d/MMM/yy* to *dd/MM/yyyy*.
 # Create or edit an issue and type a number date in the Due Date field with format *d/m/yy* such as *1/1/14* for example
 # Then click create or edit.
 # After it is created or updated, go to the issue and click edit.

h3. Actual Results:
The date typed is accepted and the Due Date field is storing 01/01/0014 instead of 2014.

h3. Suggestion
Add some validator and warning message in JIRA UI when a user enters a date using dd/MM/yy, while the input date format is set to dd/MM/yyyy, so that the wrong year does not get set in JIRA.

h3. Notes

It was decided in this original bug ticket that this behavior was actually not a bug, but an expected behavior due to the following reason:
{code:java}
For parsing, if the number of pattern letters is more than 2, the year is interpreted literally, regardless of the number of digits. So using the pattern "MM/dd/yyyy", "01/11/12" parses to Jan 11, 12 A.D.
{code}
source:
- http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/index.html?java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html
- https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/11/docs/api/java.base/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

Having said that, in order to avoid any confusion for JIRA users, it would be great to do a check on JIRA side on the input data before the date gets processed in the backend by the Java class.
fields.summary: Add some validator and warning message in UI when a user enters only 2 digits of the year in format dd/MM/yyyy

fields.description:
From this documentation [Defining priority field values|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-priority-field-values-938847101.html], it doesn't state clearly enough what kind of Priority values would work. E.g numbers, or texts. Users will tend to expect that all values will work without issues.

However, a known issue when using numerical Priority values in Jira, is that when searching via JQL, we will run into [JRASERVER\-37238: If the Priority Name is only a Number, Issue Navigator will return issues matching its Name or ID|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37238]

h5. Suggestion

We could update the documentation, showing a warning when using numerical Priority values we might run into [JRASERVER-37238|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37238].
fields.summary: Update the Jira Priority documentation to warn users about using numerical Priority values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There was a server-side template injection vulnerability in Jira Server and Data Center, in the Jira Importers Plugin (JIM). An attacker with "JIRA Administrators" access can exploit this issue. Successful exploitation of this issue allows an attacker to remotely execute code on systems that run a vulnerable version of Jira Server or Data Center. 

Affected version: 
* Versions of Jira Server & Jira Data Center starting with 7.0.10 before 7.6.16, from 7.7.0 before 7.13.8 (the fixed version for 7.13.x), from 8.0.0 before 8.1.3 (the fixed version for 8.1.x), from 8.2.0 before 8.2.5 (the fixed version for 8.2.x), and from 8.3.0 before 8.3.4 (the fixed version for 8.3.x) , and from 8.4.0 before 8.4.1 (the fixed version for 8.4.x)  are affected by this vulnerability. 

h3. Fix

We have released the following versions of Jira Server & Jira Data Center to address this issue:

* 8.4.1 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download
* 8.3.4 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 8.2.5 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 8.1.3 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 7.13.8 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 7.6.16 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update

We have released the following versions of Jira Software Server to address this issue:

* 8.4.1 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download
* 8.3.4 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 8.2.5 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 8.1.3 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 7.13.8 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update
* 7.6.16 which is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-security-advisory-2019-09-18-976766250.html].
fields.summary: Template injection  in Jira importers plugin - CVE-2019-15001

fields.description:
The CSV Importer offers two functionality to users, one available to general users and other restricted to Jira Admin.

{color:#ff0000}*The documentation of the first references fields only available to the other.*{color}

{color:#172b4d}Target documentation to change: {color} [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939937906.html]
h2. Creating issues using the CSV importer (general users)
 * Users must have Create Issue and Bulk Edit permissions.

Documentation: [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939937906.html]
 Documentation references these 5 fields that are only available on the "Admin Version" of this functionality:
 * Worklog
 * Project Key
 * Project Name
 * Attachments
 * Comment Body

h2. Importing data from CSV (Jira Admins)
 * Only available to Jira Admins on the Cog > System > Import and Export

Documentation: [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html]
  
h3. Additional info

It'd be interesting if, on the [bulk creating doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-939937906.html], we presented an infobox somehow alerting about the the fields only available on the [Jira Admin's External System Import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html]:
||Field||
|Worklog|
|Project (key, name and type)|
|Attachments|
|Comment Body|
|Status|
|Resolution|
|Date Resolved|
|Date Modified|
|Date Created|
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a csv file with the following fields, besides whatever fields are required to the project: Worklog, Project name, project key, project type, Attachments, Comment Body, Status, Resolution, Resolved Date, Updated Date, Created Date
 # Map the fields accordingly and perform a successful import on Admin's External System CSV Import
 # Save the configuration file
 # Perform a Bulk Issue Creation on Issues > Import Issues from CSV and use the same csv file and same configuration file

The result is that the fields listed above won't be available to map, forcing the user to select other fields instead.
fields.summary: Documentation on Bulk Issue Creation references fields only available on External System CSV Import
Support Openshift / Kubernetes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Certain JQL functions can trigger a ClauseTooComplexSearchException if too many search results are returned when using the functions, including (but not limited to):
* worklogDate
* worklogAuthor
* fixVersion
* closedSprints() - JSWSERVER-20283 

In the UI, the search fails, and this error is presented:
 !image-2019-09-05-16-52-00-762.png|thumbnail! 

By default, Jira is configured with a limit of up to 65000 search clauses - if the function will return more than this number of issues, the exception will be thrown. This is true even if the overall JQL query will not return less than 65000 issues; for example, the overall query can be constrained with a term such as (issuekey = TEST-123), which should only return 1 issue, and it will still fail.

h3. Environment

Tested in Jira 7.6.9 and Jira 7.13.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create at least 65000 issues which have worklog entries. The [Data Generator for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] is effective for creating these issues, but should never be used in a Production environment.
# Re-index the environment as needed to ensure that all issues are searchable
# Perform a query that uses the affected function (i.e. worklogDate < now()) so that over 65000 issues will be returned.

h3. Expected Results

The search succeeds, and the full result set is returned.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{code}2019-09-05 16:38:55,419 http-nio-8041-exec-20 ERROR kliou 998x2294x2 rdp65t 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable [c.a.j.p.i.service.issuetable.DefaultIssueTableService] com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseTooComplexSearchException: A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {issuekey in (100000, 1000001, 1000002, 1000003, 1000004
...
999996, 999997, 999998, 999999)}
{code}

The following error is shown in the UI, and the search does not return any values:
{quote}An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.{quote}

h3. Notes

This is very similar, or identical, to [JSWSERVER-16401 : Having a huge set of versions causes Boards to break|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16401], which is the same problem when using *fixVersion*.

h3. Workaround

It is possible to work around this issue by increasing the number of allowable clauses used in searches. 

* (!) Not recommended. Increase the default limit of 65000, but it is not known how this will affect future performance of the system. This can be done by increasing the value for jira.search.maxclauses in *jira-application.properties* file located in following directory:
{code}
<JIRA-INSTALL-DIRECTORY><atlassian-jira>/WEB-INF/classes/
{code}
fields.summary: Using certain JQL functions causes a ClauseTooComplexSearchException when many values exist in the database

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a double copy of a simplified workflow occurs, trying to edit the workflow or create another draft results in 500 errors

h3. Environment

Jira Server 7.6.4, 7.6.14 and 7.13.6 were used to reproduce this bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to System / Issues / Workflows
# Right click on Copy link for a workflow, to open copy operation in a new window
# Double-click on Copy

h3. Expected Results

A new workflow gets created via Copy.

h3. Actual Results

Different results occur depending on the copied workflow.
For a simplified workflow, a 500 error page titled "Oops..." appears.
For other workflows, the error appears on the page that a workflow with this name already exists, there is no data corruption however.
 
The access log shows an error 500 on the return response.
The application log shows an error like:

{code}
2019-08-21 08:20:03,892 http-nio-8080-exec-43 url:/secure/admin/w...lowDispatcher.jspa username:1572322 url:/internal-error ERROR      [c.a.j.web.servlet.InternalServerErrorServlet] {errorId=61986c79-c329-420b-acfb-cf8215dad6bf, interpretedMsg=, cause=com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: There are more than one workflows associated with 'Copy of ACBS delete1' in the database!, stacktrace=com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: There are more than one workflows associated with 'Copy of ACBS delete1' in the database!
{code}

Furthermore, in the case of this error 500 happening with a duplicated simplified workflow, all the workflows disappear from the admin page. Afterwards workflows are no longer editable. When clicking on workflow in a project, the error appears:

{quote}
The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
{quote}

h3. Notes

This happens because of wrong user action (double-click), however the page logic should prevent a double-click from occurring.

h3. Workaround

The extra workflow needs to be deleted from the database (the duplicated workflow from 'jiraworkflows' will have the same name as the previous copy).
fields.summary: Copying an workflow in new browser tab causes error 500

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, In order to show Jira issues in "Jira links" in Confluence page, users will have to mention the Jira issue in the Confluence page. 

Some users would like function where they would like to mention the Confluence page (Eg: in the Description field) and they would like to see both the Jira issue and Confluence page linked together. When this action is done, Confluence should also display the Jira issue which the Confluence link is added under "Jira links".


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Jira/Confluence to create a reciprocal link when a Confluence page link is added to the issue description.


h3. Workaround 

Add the issue link to the Confluence page. This will make the Jira issue to be listed under "Jira links" in Confluence page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating an issue as a user with no Edit Issue permission fails when setting JPO Target Start and Target End fields during issue creation with the error:


{code:java}
we can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields

# Create a Jira Software Project with Sample Data

fields.description:
As the Atlassian JIRA product gains more market exposure, there are customers who've utilized services such as Saleforce for various purposes and mainly the CRM functionality.
With the Atlassian Marketplace growth, there are many Apps supporting the need to cutover completely from Salesforce to JSD and maintain a CRM-like schema. However, the JIRA External System Import and Salesforce integration component is missing to make the cutover a success. Will there be any effort to making this Import Feature available with option to import attachments from Salesforce?
fields.summary: External System Import for Salesforce in JSD

fields.description:
For any ALM JIRA project, the Links list is missing for each linked JIRA issues, their respective Resolution field next to the Status field.

Not seeing the Resolution field for each linked issue is problematic as unable to know at first look the reason why a linked issue was closed. Ex.: Is a linked issue closed resolved, closed no change, closed duplicate, or closed withdrawn? 
For each case a different outcome when time comes to close a parent issue, reviewing all linked blocking descendants for their respective closure resolution.

We had a couple issues where parents got closed resolved from combination of descendants that were closed - no change or closed withdrawn, leading to prematurely closing the parent as resolved when none of its linked descendants actually did any fix. The parent was therefore not fixed at all, but got advertised to our customer as having been fixed.

So to improve WP closure efficiency and accuracy, and minimize mistakes, it would be a premium to have both the Status and the Resolution fields shown side by side for each linked descendants on the Links list.
fields.summary: ALM JIRA Links - missing resolution field along with the Status field

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

If the username of a user is changed, when clicking on the Assignee of a ticket from the page *Project Settings > Versions > Click on any version*, the profile URL is generated using the old username. If we click on that profile URL, we are redirected to an invalid page and we get the error:
{quote}
The specified user could not be found.
{quote}


h3. +Steps to reproduce+

# Create a new user in *⚙ > User Management > Users* with user name jrey20
# Assign this user to a Jira ticket
# Create a version in the project the ticket was created in, and add this version to the ticket
# Change the username from jrey20 to jrey21.
# Open the issue search page
# Hover over the assignee and verify that the profile link is correct and points to jrey21:
!IssueSearch.png|thumbnail!
# Open the page Releases and click on a version (1.0) to view the list of tickets with this version

h3. +Workaround+

Change the username back to the original username

fields.description:
When performing a search with a JQL and exporting the results to CSV file, the CSV file will include custom fields that has specific context for projects that are not included in the result set.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

1) Having the following scenario with 2 custom fields, each associated with a different project contexts:

_Custom Field A_
 _Context: Project A_

_Custom Field B_
 _Context: Project B_

2) Create a JQL query that contains results for just one of the projects, for example:

JQL: {{text ~ "profit"}}
 Results: 1 (ProjectB-1)
 Projects included in results: Project B

3) Export the results to a CSV file (All Fields):
h3. Observed behaviour

Both custom fields are exported to the CSV file: "Custom Field A", "Custom Field B" as columns.
 We can see "Custom Field A" column in the CSV file, however, there are no issues in the query that belongs to Project A.
h3. Expected behaviour

Only "Custom Field B" should be exported to the CSV file.
fields.summary: CSV exports of JQL results may include all custom fields even when only a single project is represented in the result set

fields.description:
We need to massively collect Jira information (millions of issues) and export it to an analytics tool, and we need to have access control in these massive operations.

We know two ways of doing this: generating an output file (XML) or a Bulk API operation. These two significantly affect Jira's performance. Today we already do this via API generating a huge volume of IO accesses due to pagination of queries.

Would be great if there is a built-in tool to easily export a massive number of issues while not affecting so much the performance of the application.
fields.summary: Tool to massively export issues in readable format that doesn't affect performance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

When configuring a mail handler in *JIRA > ⚙ > System > Incoming Mail*, we can see that following description is displayed under the *Catch Email* Address* field:
{quote}
If set, only emails having the specified recipient in fields To, Cc or Bcc will be processed.
{quote}


The problem is that since the *Bcc:* header will be removed *most of the time* by the mail server that is sending the email to the recipients mentioned in *Bcc:*, there might not be any scenario or use case where the mail handler will actually catch the email address from the *Bcc:* (since it might never be there).

The only scenario where the *Bcc:* won't be removed (tested in gmail) is when the email address in the *From:* and in the *To:* headers are the same: in this case, the email received by the sender (who is the same as the recipient) will still contain the *Bcc:* header. But this use case does not seem to be a scenario that will be used by our customers, since most of the time the email in the *From:* and in the *To:* headers will be different.

h3. Suggested solution

Improve the description of the *Catch Email Address* setting by mentioning that:
- the JIRA Mail Handler will catch the email address in the *BCC:* header *only if it's there*
- since the mail server will likely remove the *Bcc:* header, therefore we don't recommend adding the catch email address to the *BCC:* header, but to the *To:* and *Cc:* header instead
fields.summary: Improve the description under the Catch Email Address setting of JIRA Mail Handlers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There is an option to use JQL when finding issues to link. However, when adding the ORDER BY sort, Jira returns an error message of "Invalid JQL Query", although it shows a green tick.
There is a similar feature request in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69832. This bug ticket is to report the behavior where a green tick shows but the JQL cannot return results.

h3. Environment
Jira 7.8.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh instance.
# Create a test project. Use the key "TEST".
# Navigate to any issue, and attempt to link it to another issue.
# Click on "Search for an issue".
# Click on "Advanced Search".
# Use the following JQL.
{code}
project = test ORDER BY createdDate ASC
{code}
# Hit enter.

h3. Expected Results
# Green tick shows when typing the JQL.
# List of results, sorted by createdDate ASC appears.

h3. Actual Results
# Green tick shows when typing the JQL.
# Error message "Invalid JQL Query" appears.
 !image-2019-09-03-17-48-39-005.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround yet.
fields.summary: Including ORDER BY in JQL for issue linking shows "Invalid JQL Query" although there is  a green tick.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From the Jira advanced settings, setting *jira.clone.prefix* value and pressing ENTER from *keyboard* revert *jira.attachment.number.of.zip.entries* to default value. Setting *jira.data.picker.javascript.format* value and pressing ENTER from keyboard revert *jira.date.time.picker.java.format* to default value

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira Advanced Settings
 # Change the value of jira.attachment.number.of.zip.entries
 # Change the value of jira.clone.prefix and press ENTER from the keyboard
 # The value of jira.attachment.number.of.zip.entries is reverted to default
 
  # Go to Jira Advanced Settings
 # Change the value of jira.date.time.picker.java.format
 # Change the value of jira.data.picker.javascript.format and press ENTER from the keyboard
 # The value of jira.date.time.picker.java.format is reverted to default

The issue is reproducible with all the Advanced fields at the following way:
Pressing *ENTER* on input field will revert first custom value from top to bottom.
Setting 10 custom values and then press enter on some value after them for 10 times - all 10 values will be reverted one after each other 

I attached a screen recording of the issue:

h3. Workaround
Modify the values by clicking the *Update* button in the UI.
fields.summary: setting jira.clone.prefix value and jira.data.picker.javascript.format value pressing keyboard ENTER revert jira.attachment.number.of.zip.entries and jira.date.time.picker.java.format to default value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a node tries to register a cluster lock, it will try to register it in a local memory, and then register it in the database, which we expect may fail as another node may have already created this entry.

The problem happens if this code (that is creating the cluster lock) is executed within an existing database transaction. In that case, the whole transaction is marked to be rolled back, rather than accepting the error as part of the algorithm.

h3. Environment
* Jira Data Center 8.3+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This issue can be reproduced with regular actions such as:
* archiving multiple issues in a row.
* transitioning issues.

h3. Expected Results
Operations would complete with no errors.

h3. Actual Results
Users may see an error on the screen:
|!example1.png|thumbnail!|!example2.png|thumbnail!| 

These exceptions are thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
ERROR: current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
{noformat}

{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionRuntimeException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericTransactionException: Commit failed, rollback previously requested by nested transaction.
{noformat}

{noformat}
ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "cluster_lock_name_idx"
  Detail: Key (lock_name)=(sla_issue_update_51855) already exists.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating an issue causes TransactionRuntimeException or "current transaction is aborted" errors

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Based on JRASERVER-42282, executing requests to {{issue/createmeta}} on larger instances can take over a minute to complete and generate large content (500MB+).
The main problem with the old {{createmeta}} endpoint is that it is duplicating values in the response. Although the response can be filtered, due to the design of the endpoint it is very easy to cause downtime.

h3. Suggested Solution
We have been working on a fix for this problem most of the solutions made the endpoint harder and more complex to use. So we decided to *deprecate* the old endpoint and introduce new endpoints that will replace the old createmeta endpoint.

(!) 
Changes will be released with Jira 8.4.0 and the *old createmeta will be removed in Jira 9*. We suggest anyone who is using the old endpoint to migrate to the new endpoints.

You can find more details [Createmeta REST endpoint to be removed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/createmeta-rest-endpoint-to-be-removed-975040986.html]
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Remove old CreateMeta API

fields.description:
The findByComponentName method of the ProjectComponentManager class accepts the “String componentName” parameter, but currently, it's case sensitive. The issue is that cannot have components with the same names but different cases, so it shouldn't matter the casing in for this parameter.

The suggestion is to use "toUpperCase()" method to ignore the case in this search.

The current workaround is to use the "findByComponentNameCaseInSensitive" method, although this one doesn't accept the project ID as a parameter and you need to filter the projects.
fields.summary: ProjectComponentManager.findByComponentName shouldn't be case sensitive

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

In our official documentation [Connecting Jira to an LDAP directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-938847052.html], there is no mention of what happens to a user who has already been sync into JIRA when this user is deleted on the LDAP side.

*Suggested improvement*

Add a section to the documentation that explains what happens when a user is deleted from the LDAP directory, based on the following information:
{panel}
If a user is removed from the LDAP directory, the following will happen:
- if the user does not have any activity in Jira, this user will be automatically deleted from Jira on the next sync between Jira and the LDAP
- if the user already has some activity in Jira, this user will be set to "inactive", which means that this user will still exist in Jira's user database, but won't consume any Jira license and won't be able to login

A user is considered to have some activity in Jira if this user:
- added comments to Jira tickets
- is set to any user picker field in Jira tickets (for example: assignee, reporter, etc...)
{panel}
fields.summary: Improve the documentation about connecting JIRA to LDAP to explain what happens when a user is deleted from LDAP

h3. Workaround

fields.summary: Include option to always allow for status change when moving issues between projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

In our [documentation about the Jira Core Mail Handler|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver079/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-950288929.html], we mention the following point related to the *Catch Email Address* setting:
{quote}
If specified, only email messages whose To:, Cc:, Bcc: lines contain the recipient specified in this field will be processed — for example, issues@mycompany.com
{quote}

The problem is that since the *Bcc:* header will be removed *most of the time* by the mail server who is sending the email to the recipients mentioned in *Bcc:*, it seems that there won't be any scenario or use case where the mail handler will actually catch the email address from the *Bcc:* (since it might never be there).

We have 2 open bug tickets about the fact that the *Catch Email* setting does not work when the email address is in *Bcc:*:
- for JIRA Cloud: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44680
- for JIRA Server: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44680

However, it is not JIRA bug, since the problem comes down to the fact that by design, mail servers will remove the *Bcc:* header.

The only scenario where the *Bcc:* won't be removed (tested in gmail) is when the email address in the *From:* and in the *To:* headers are the same: in this case, the email received by the sender (who is the same as the recipient) will still contain the *Bcc:* header. But this use case does not seem to be a scenario that will be used by our customers, since most of the time the email in the *From:* and in the *To:* headers will be different.

h3. Suggested solution

Improve our documentation by mentioning that:
- the JIRA Mail Handler will catch the email address in the *BCC:* header *only if it's there*
- since the mail server will likely remove the *Bcc:* header, therefore we don't recommend adding the catch email address to the *BCC:* header, but to the *To:* and *Cc:* header instead
fields.summary: Improve the documentation about the Jira Mail Handler (catch email address setting)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary It is not possible to search for Confluence Cloud spaces when linking Confluence page from Jira issue. User get an error "Unable to collect information from the selected Confluence instance". h3. Environment * Jira Server, application link to Confluence Cloud h3. Steps to Reproduce # Link Confluence Cloud instance to Jira Server # Go to an Issue > Link > Confluence page > Search for a page h3. Expected Results The space search is performed and results are returned. h3. Actual Results The following error is thrown in the browser: {code:java} "Unable to collect information from the selected Confluence instance" {code} Enabling {{org.apache.http}} log reveals that Jira is hitting Confluence Cloud endpoint that does not exist: {noformat} 2019-08-29 11:06:54,678 http-nio-8080-exec-1595 DEBUG admin 666x744009x1 hkkf9o xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx,yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy /rest/confluenceIssueLink/1/confluence/space [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-10263 >> "POST /wiki/rpc/xmlrpc HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]" ... http-outgoing-10263 << "HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found[\r][\n]" ... 2019-08-29 11:06:54,713 http-nio-8080-exec-1595 DEBUG admin 666x744009x1 hkkf9o xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx,yyy.yyy.yyy.yyy /rest/confluenceIssueLink/1/confluence/space [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-10263 << "

404 Not Found

Oops, you've found a dead link. Click here to return to the previous page

" {noformat} h3. Notes *The actual cause for this bug is SOAP / XML-RPC deprecation on Confluence*: [https://blog.developer.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud-soap-api-migration/]. However, due to the fact that the endpoint has been preserved on Confluence Server, we cannot reproduce that issue if Jira is linked to Confluence Server. The page search method should be replaced with {{GET /wiki/rest/api/space}}. h3. Workaround Link a Confluence page directly to Jira issue.
fields.summary: Not possible to search for Confluence Cloud spaces when linking Confluence page from Jira issue

When bulk editing issues on Jira on large data sets (more than 1000 issues), Jira allows users to click on the checkbox to select all issues. While the check mark appears, no issues are actually selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Click on Tools > Bulk Change

fields.description:
Original problem raised in PS with data consistency of Jira XML export:

We have detected that the broken foreign key relation is broken because the AO_8B1069_ACTIVITY_ENTRY gets some rows added during the export. We removed all modify permissions from the Permission Schemes while the export was done, but these are inserted via XRay REST API. So, those rows don't appear in the activeobjects.xml file, but rows from AO_8B1069_ACTIVITY_ITEM referencing them appear.

The suggestion was made regarding the data consistency of exports:

I would suggest that the export is done from a snapshot of the database (maybe create the export from inside a serializable transaction). I cannot tell for sure, but I think some of the data (maybe entities.xml) is taken from a coherent snapshot, as we suffered some issues with the size of the rollback/undo tablespace in Oracle, which suggests that a long transaction is being run during the backup. However, the information from the active objects or Add-ons tables seems not to be coherent during the backup. 

 It might be as easy as running the whole export inside a transaction if the database backend supports it (maybe it needs to be a "serializable transaction", the most strict type, to avoid that inserts done by other transactions during the export are visible). Running inside a transaction might require a big rollback/undo buffer, so maybe this should be included as an option (the user can choose to run the export inside a transaction to ensure integrity at the cost of performance or requiring additional space on the database server).

This should not be quite difficult to achieve and would fix many issues related to exports, that are not detected until you try the import.
fields.summary: Perform exports from snapshot rather than live data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When dragging/dropping issues in a Sprint, it will initiate 2 AJAX requests (noticeable in instance with performance problem). In between the requests (after the 1st request but before the 2nd request), it is possible to drag/drop other issues. Once the 2nd request is made, it will cause the issue to be moved to the Backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(!) The Bug is heavily dependent on the instance's performance
# Have a Backlog with over 1000 issues, create a Sprint
** To increase the probability, expand the backlog to show all the issues
# Drag/drop any issues in the Sprint
** This will initiate the 2 AJAX requests (the screen will be greyed out twice)
# In between the 2 AJAX requests, drag/drop some other issue in the Sprint
** You will notice that the dragged issue will appear to have a duplicate:
 !DoubleIssue.png|thumbnail! 
# Once the 2nd AJAX request occurs, the dragged issue will be moved to the backlog

h3. Expected Results
Issues would be moved in the Sprint and not moved out to the Backlog

h3. Actual Results
The issue will be moved out to the Backlog

h3. Suggested solution:
There should be a lock between the 2 AJAX requests, hence users would not be able to drag/drop issues.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Drag/drop issues in a Sprint (planning mode)  would cause the issue to go back to Backlog

fields.description:
Natively, Jira counts with a great and very convenient feature: [global reflexive transitions|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/How-to-get-to-the-next-level-in-workflow-design/ba-p/1135968].

However, that feature is really difficult to discover, as it currently requires to:

# Enter the workflow editor in diagram mode.
# Click on the Add transition button (please, note that the most popular method for adding transitions is drag&drop on status nodes).
# Select Any status in the From status dropdown field.
# Select Itself in the To status dropdown field.
# Add a Name & click on the Save button.

Counting with more intuitive ways through the UI for creating this kind of transition would be desirable.

Maybe it would be a good idea prompting a dialog on creating a looping transition (a transition from a status to itself). The dialog could show a concise text and a couple of buttons:

* Text: Looping transitions are frequently useful from other statuses too. Would you like to create a global looping transition instead?
* Button 1: Make global
* Button 2: No, thanks

Additionally, a Read more or icon would ideally link to a documentation page which explained the advantages of using global looping transitions.
fields.summary: UX: Facilitate natural discovery of global looping transitions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As per [Advanced Jira application configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/advanced-jira-application-configuration-938847847.html], default values for Jira's available advanced configuration options are stored the {{jpm.xml}} file, and the {{jira-config.properties}} should be used to override those values. However, the values for the look and feel in Jira are not changed accordingly in the interface after applying them to {{jira-config.properties}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a fresh Jira installation (without modifications to the look and feel), add a {{jira-config.properties}} file to the Jira Home folder.
# Add the following line:
{code:java| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
jira.lf.top.bgcolour=#ffffff
{code}
# And restart Jira

h3. Expected Results
The *Header Background Colour* would be white as defined in the {{jira-config.properties}} file (which would change the default color for this property, which would then be possible to override through the UI).

h3. Actual Results
There is no change in the colour. However, the *Header Background Colour* shows {{#ffffff}} in the *Look and Feel* page.

h3. Workaround
* Manually change the colour in the *Look and Feel* page
fields.summary: Updating the Look and Feel through the jira-config.properties doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA renders wrong value when entering a large value in Estimated Time field when time tracking format is set to 'days'.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the time tracking format to 'days' from default 'pretty'.
 # Enter a large value for the time estimated say 15509609h.
 # The value gets converted to three-dimensional value 1,938,701d 15,509,605h 930,576,254m which is way much bigger than original number.
 !image-2019-08-28-18-35-16-929.png|width=318,height=188!
 # This is happening even after re-indexing.
 # This happens only when entering large values for the estimated time. Works fine for small values.

h3. Expected Results

The estimated time should render the correct values for even large values entered in the estimated time field.
h3. Actual Results

The values are rendered as three-dimensional and much bigger than the original number.
h3. Notes

Able to replicate this behavior on 7.13.0, 8.2.2
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to change the time tracking format to default value 'Pretty' from 'Days'.
fields.summary: JIRA renders wrong value when entering a large value in Estimated Time field when time tracking format is set to 'days'.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a Looping transitions on a workflow from "Any Status" to "Itself" after creation, you cannot be able to use the Advanced Configuration options as the links to it would be broken.

h3. Environment
Jira Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Goto any Workflow, add the "Any Status" to "Itself" transition and give it a name
 # Click on the newly added transition, on the right side of the screen where the Workflow Advanced configuration pops up for ( Properties, Conditions, Post-function etc.) 
 # Clicking on any of those URL links shows a 404 error.

h3. Expected Results

The URL link should be able to work

h3. Actual Results

The Link appears to have appended a workflow step parameter with "undefined" value and thus returns a 404 page when clicked.
{code}
https://<your-instance>/secure/admin/workflows/ViewWorkflowTransitionMetaAttributes.jspa?workflowMode=live&workflowName=Copy+2+of+Software+Simplified+Workflow+for+Project+AT&workflowTransition=51&workflowStep=undefined 
{code}
 !404-error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
It seems as though Jira is expecting a workflow Status Step where there's none, as the transition is a loop to itself. Hence the "undefined" value added to the parameter.

h3. Workaround

* Save the workflow first before trying to access those Advanced Configuration.
* Reload the Workflow Configuration Page, before clicking on the Advanced configuration options.
fields.summary: Looping Transitions Workflow returns a Broken link for Advanced Configuration after creation.

ajax[1551692] error : {

	status      : 400,
	statusText  : error,

	readyState  : 4,

fields.description:
h5. Current Design
When deleting an "Issue Link Type", the admin is provided with an option to move the existing issue links to a different "Link Type".

Sometimes the inward and outward links do not match.  For example:
* Issue Link Type: Prevent
** Outward descrption: Preventing
** Inward description: Prevented
* Issue Link Type: Block
** Outward description: Blocked By
** Inward description: Blocked

When deleting the "Prevent" issue type and moving to "Block", all the issue link types would end up going in the wrong direction.
* If you have an Issue1 that is "Preventing" Issue2 and migrate to "Block", the new wording would show that Issue1 is "Blocked By", which is incorrect.
fields.summary: When Deleting Issue Link Types Provide Option to Switch Inward and Outward Links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the issue search screen, on detail view, If you resize the browser window so the left/right scroll appears when you move it the bar that divides the list of issue and the details will move together with the scroll. This makes the bar go over the details in the issue.

h3. Environment
Reproducible in Chrome and Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Issues > Search for issues".
 # Select "Detail view".
 # Resize the browser window enough to make the bottom scroll bar appear.
 # Scroll the window left and right.

h3. Expected Results

The whole page scrolls left and right.
h3. Actual Results

The page scrolls, but the bar dividing the issue list and issue detail moves along with the scroll making the bar hover the issue details.

h3. Workaround

There's no workaround as of yet, the only option is to make the window bigger enough so the bottom scroll disappears.
fields.summary: Divide bar in Issue Search screen moves with scrolling.

fields.description:
Workflow transitions can currently be restricted by advanced workflow properties according to group, user, assignee, reporter, lead, user custom field, and project role. This is done using  the Permissions class and the {{jira.permission.*}} property (see [Workflow properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/workflow-properties-938847526.html]).

Customers need to be able to restrict based on both status and issue type, and there is not a straightforward was of doing this without restricting the move issue permission, which is too constraining for this use case.
fields.summary: Restrict issue move operation using workflow status and issue type

fields.description:
In the following scenario, when running the following REST API query to return issues within a certain range of "Updated" dates.
{code:java}
/rest/api/2/search?jql=(updated%3E=%272019/04/01%27%26%26updated%3C%272019/08/09%27)&Content-Type=application/json&fields=%27field1,%20field2,...%27
{code}
It'll return the following data, as example:
||Key||Updated||
|SSD-1|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-2|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-3|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-4|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-5|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-6|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-7|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-8|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-9|01/Aug/2019|

When using {{maxResults=5}}, we have the following:
{code:java}
/rest/api/2/search?jql=(updated%3E=%272019/04/01%27%26%26updated%3C%272019/08/09%27)&Content-Type=application/json&fields=%27field1,%20field2,...%27&maxResults=5
{code}
||Key||Updated||
|SSD-1|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-2|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-3|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-4|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-5|01/Aug/2019|

Before browsing to page 2 (startAt=5), issue SSD-5 is modified, resulting in the Updated field to be changed, therefore, making this issue outside of the query scope.

Browsing to page 2, (startAt=5). We have the following output:
{code:java}
/rest/api/2/search?jql=(updated%3E=%272019/04/01%27%26%26updated%3C%272019/08/09%27)&Content-Type=application/json&fields=%27field1,%20field2,...%27&maxResults=4&startAt=5
{code}
||Key||Updated||
|SSD-7|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-8|01/Aug/2019|
|SSD-9|01/Aug/2019|

Notice that SSD-6 is not visible in page 2, since SSD-5 was modified, SSD-6 shifted to the previous page.
h3. Expected behaviour

Jira should prevent this behaviour by making the returned issues consistent when using the REST API pagination.
fields.summary: Issues may not be visible when using the REST API and pagination

fields.description:
When there is an SSL error connecting to your Jira instance, the description of what is wrong is currently vague, leaving the administrator with little information as to what is wrong.

 

For example (my case)

The Jira Server mobile app relies on the system trusted CAs, which sometimes don't include LetsEncrypt, browsers on the other hand _do_ trust LetsEncrypt. So when attempting to sign into Jira on one of these devices without LetsEncrypt as a trusted CA, The Jira Mobile app says "oh can't get a secure connection", while opening Jira in a browser on the same device works fine, leaving the hapless with no clue as to what is wrong.
fields.summary: When configuring the mobile app, the error screen for when a ssl error is present should be a bit more descriptive

fields.description:
*Issue:*

Currently when searching using issueLinkType = "is blocked by", the system also gives back issues where all the linked/blocking issues are complete. 

This makes the function somewhat useless when using it to find issues with only OPEN blockers, as would be the general use.

*Suggested Resolution:*

Please add the ability or a search operator to omit issues where the linked blocking issues are in the 'done' status.
fields.summary: When using 'issueLinkType = "is blocked by"', do not show issues where all blockers are in a 'done' status

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira administrators would benefit from having a way to bypass permissions and browse all projects and issues. This would be useful for troubleshooting issues such as JQL queries returning unexpected resiults, since issues from projects for which the user doesn't have *Browse Project* permission wouldn't be returned.

In large Jira instances it might not be practical to change all permission schemes in order to include all administrators before troubleshooting an issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a feature to toggle bypass of permissions for some users or groups. For example, Jira System Administrators.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator, I would like to bypass permissions and be able to browse all projects

fields.description:
Having a "/status" endpoint for load balancer health checks is good, but some simple enhancements could make load balancer integration much more functional.  I can see two compelling use cases:
1. When shutting down one cluster member for maintenance/upgrade:  As of today (8.3/4.3), the minimally disruptive way to shut down one cluster node is
 -- Go to load balancer, disable node1
 -- Shut down Jira on node 1
 -- Start up Jira on node 1
 -- Go to load balancer, re-enable node1
 and repeat for node 2 in (say) a rolling upgrade.

 If Jira would change the return code from /status to (e.g.) "STOPPING" for a small period of time before shutting down, the manual interaction with the load balancer could be avoided. The shutdown delay would need to be tunable (e.g. via a property), so customers could match behaviour with the load balancer health check interval.

2. When performing an offline re-index.

The post-upgrade procedure for a rolling upgrade suggests that you should:
-- Remove one node from the load-balancer
-- Perform an offline index
-- Add the node back in to the load-balancer
-- Copy the resulting index to the other nodes

Now, this is /possible/ by adding additional listeners to server.xml and connecting directly to the target host, but when combined with SAML login it starts to require serious gymnastics.  

It could be done automatically, however, by adding a 'cluster-aware offline rebuild' mode that :
-- set /status to return (e.g.) "OFFLINE"
-- wait long enough for the load balancer to notice
-- perform the offline rebuild
-- set /status to return "RUNNING" again
-- copy resulting index to the other nodes.

Regards,
fields.summary: Load balancer status URL improvements

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Database Latency Check feature implemented on JRASERVER-66980 fails on SQL Server when Jira's database uses a schema other than 'dbo'.
h3. Environment

Jira 7.13.3 or later
 SQL Server: 2012, 2014, 2016
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a database for Jira
 # Create a database user which Jira will connect as
 # Create an empty 'schema' in the database for the Jira tables
 # Install Jira and connect to the newly created database

h3. Expected Results

The query to normally execute and show results under *Jira admin > System > System Info > Database latency measurement milliseconds*.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2019-08-21 17:54:58,021 http-nio-8080-exec-13 ERROR rparmigiani 1074x184x1 vyxt7d 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ViewSystemInfo.jspa [c.a.j.util.system.ExtendedSystemInfoUtilsImpl] Exception while measuring database query select count(*) from productlicense
java.lang.RuntimeException: Exception while measuring database query select count(*) from productlicense
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.measure.ClockBasedDatabaseQueryMeter.measure(ClockBasedDatabaseQueryMeter.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.measure.CheapSelectDatabaseLatencyMeter.lambda$measure$0(CheapSelectDatabaseLatencyMeter.java:25)

	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:216)
	at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:62)
	at webwork.view.taglib.IteratorTag.doStartTag(IteratorTag.java:71)
	at jsp.secure.admin.jira.views.systeminfo_jsp._jspx_meth_ww_005fiterator_005f1(systeminfo_jsp.java:1504)
	at jsp.secure.admin.jira.views.systeminfo_jsp._jspx_meth_aui_005fparam_005f8(systeminfo_jsp.java:1435)
	at jsp.secure.admin.jira.views.systeminfo_jsp._jspx_meth_aui_005fcomponent_005f3(systeminfo_jsp.java:1266)
	at jsp.secure.admin.jira.views.systeminfo_jsp._jspService(systeminfo_jsp.java:130)

Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: Invalid object name 'productlicense'.
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException.makeFromDatabaseError(SQLServerException.java:256)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.getNextResult(SQLServerStatement.java:1621)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.doExecuteStatement(SQLServerStatement.java:868)

	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.executeQuery(SQLServerStatement.java:693)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingStatement.java:207)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingStatement.java:207)
	at com.atlassian.jira.database.measure.ClockBasedDatabaseQueryMeter.measure(ClockBasedDatabaseQueryMeter.java:29)
	... 406 more
{noformat}
Also, *Database latency measurement milliseconds* field gets replaced in Jira's UI and shows: *Error accessing database (more in logs) java.lang.RuntimeException: Exception while measuring database query select count( * ) from productlicense*.

If the Jira Admin generates a Support.zip file, the line above can be spotted on the *application.xml* file almost as if it was a system property right after the database collation settings:
{noformat}
<Database-collation>SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI</Database-collation>
<Error-accessing-database-more-in-logs>java.lang.RuntimeException: Exception while measuring database query select count(*) from productlicense</Error-accessing-database-more-in-logs>
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The query that checks latency doesn't take into account the database schema. Instances running under the default 'dbo' schema will likely never see this problem.

This also affects *Integrity checker* and *support zip* generation.

h3. Workaround

If SQL Server hosts only the Jira database, then it's possible to change the schema for all tables to use dbo by following the steps at [Changing the schema for all JIRA tables under a specific schema.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-the-schema-for-all-jira-tables-under-a-specific-schema-282173461.html]
fields.summary: Database Latency Check fails on SQL Server when using a schema other than dbo

fields.description:
There are currently no good image proofing tools for Jira. Marketplace has one but the usability is far from ideal.

Just giving users a way to annotate an image, and compare versions (toggle between old/new) would open up new possibilities into how users can use Jira.

And you already have most of the code in Confluence...just drop in the Confluence image annotations to start?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The sorting is not accurate after the 51st character for text fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type *Text Field (Single Line)* (e.g. "Text Field CF")
# Create multiple issues and a sortable value for the custom field. The field value must be above 52 characters.
For a quick way, use this to generate 99 issues 
{code:bash| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
for i in {01..99}; do curl -u <username>:<password> -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:8080/rest/api/2/issue/ \
--data '{"fields": {"project":{"key": "<pkey>"},"summary": "Issue number '$i'","description": "test","issuetype": {"name": "<Type>"},"customfield_<id>" : "abc123abc123abc123abc123abc123abc123abc123abc123abc-1'$i'"}}'\
; done
{code}
# Search and sort by that field in the issue navigator. E.g.:
{code:SQL| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#F4F5F7 |bgColor=#F4F5F7}
"Text Field CF" is not EMPTY ORDER BY "Text Field CF" DESC
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Issues would be correctly sorted independently of the number of characters in the field.

h3. Actual Results
Jira only sorts up to the 51st character:
|!51chars.png|thumbnail!|!52chars.png|thumbnail!|!53chars.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sorting by Text Field is not accurate
